alert.note: Alert for Osborne (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 05 at 11:40PM CDT until June 06 at 1:30AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM CDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of north central Kansas, including the following counties, Osborne and Rooks. * WHEN...Until 200 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. River or creek flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1139 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is already occurring in the advisory area. Between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Coon Creek, Crooked Creek, Covert Creek, Paradise Creek, Jim Creek, Kill Creek, Lucky Creek, Wolf Creek, South Fork Solomon River, Boxelder Creek, Twin Creek, East Kill Creek, Douglas Creek, Elm Creek, Medicine Creek and Eagle Creek. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Natoma, Woodston and Alton.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
